metadata.synopsis:
If you did not recruit Lae'zel the first time, you recruit her the second time here.
Edge-case: Lae'zel was in the party but failed to be re-added automatically in the party. She can be recruited here.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: Have you come to your senses?

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I'd like you to join my party.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Go to my camp. We can speak there.

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *Your skull briefly aches, and you are her. You feel the woman's anger at the dragon-rider she'd confronted.*

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *You also feel answers. She knows more about your condition.*
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to player at start of node.

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: You left me for dead. I've killed my own cousins for considerably less.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to player at start of node.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: You survived longer than I expected without me to aid you.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to player at start of node.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: *You note the look in her eye, the slight tilt of her head. She is sizing you up.*
25.context: NodeContext: Tersely murmured advice. You're not going to trust her, are you?

97.speaker: Narrator
97.text: *You note the look in her eye, the slight tilt of her head. She is sizing you up.*
97.context: NodeContext: Tersely murmured advice. You're not going to trust her, are you?

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *You note the look in her eye, the slight tilt of her head. She is sizing you up.*

114.text: *The ensuing silence is deafening. You don't know what to make of it.*
114.context: NodeContext: Tersely murmured advice. You're not going to trust her, are you?

20.speaker: Narrator
20.text: *The ensuing silence is deafening. You don't know what to make of it.*
20.context: NodeContext: Tersely murmured advice. You're not going to trust her, are you?

2.speaker: Lae'zel
2.text: Yet even a feared kith'rak could not break your spirit. Yes - you may be of considerable use.
2.context: NodeContext: Tersely murmured advice. You're not going to trust her, are you?

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: I know of a cure. Lend me your skills, and I will take you to it.
116.context: NodeContext: Tersely murmured advice. You're not going to trust her, are you?

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Lies. Just get rid of her.
76.context: NodeContext: Tersely murmured advice. You're not going to trust her, are you?

72.speaker: Shadowheart
72.text: Lies. Just get rid of her.
72.context: NodeContext: Tersely murmured advice. You're not going to trust her, are you?

115.speaker: Player
115.context: InternalNodeContext: Player interacted with the situation Lae'zel Recruitment in CHA, so they saw the tieflings. The situation was auto-resolved with LZ killing the tieflings

108.speaker: Player
108.context: InternalNodeContext: Player interacted with the situation Lae'zel Recruitment in CHA, so they saw the tieflings. The situation was auto-resolved with LZ killing the tieflings

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: Naturally. I had a mission; they proved a barrier.

91.speaker: Lae'zel
91.text: Should briar hinder your path, do you not cut it down?

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I left you behind, yet you wish to join forces?
118.context: NodeContext: Some anger pierces through. KITH-rack.

12.speaker: Lae'zel
12.text: You possess a modicum of competence, though it pains me to say so.

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.text: An alliance is pragmatic - for the time being.

64.speaker: Player
64.context: NodeContext: Some anger pierces through. KITH-rack.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: A githyanki crèche must be near; its ghustil has the means to cleanse us.

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: So says my queen's teachings, and so it must be.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: And what is a crèche, exactly...?
80.context: NodeContext: Some anger pierces through. KITH-rack.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: It is many things. A hatchery, a training grounds, a shelter.

113.speaker: Lae'zel
113.text: Githyanki protocol is clear: when infected with a ghaik tadpole, we must report to a ghustil for purification.

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: One must be close at hand. We will comb the mountain pass and beyond.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Our people know a cure? Where can we find this crèche?
120.context: NodeContext: Some anger pierces through. KITH-rack.

58.speaker: Lae'zel
58.text: It must be at hand - the kith'rak had come seeking it.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: We will comb the mountain pass, and beyond.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: What just happened? Your own kind wanted your blood.
16.context: NodeContext: Some anger pierces through. KITH-rack.

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: The kith'rak is a traitor. He would deny the queen's protocol and slay his own children.
52.context: NodeContext: Some anger pierces through. KITH-rack.

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: He is a kith'rak - a githyanki knight. He is also a traitor. He denies the queen's protocol and calls for my head.

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: He says death is the only path to purification. I know this to be a lie. My cure - our cure - awaits us at a crèche.

112.speaker: Lae'zel
112.text: I might have learned more had your mouth remained closed.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: The artefact suddenly seems to weigh heavily on you. Quickly turn to other matters.
125.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount of curiosity and a bit of awe

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Show her the strange object. I believe this is the weapon the rider seeks.
49.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount of curiosity and a bit of awe

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: Gith runes. Yes - this must be it.
34.context: NodeContext: Said with some amount of curiosity and a bit of awe

48.speaker: Lae'zel
48.text: You will relinquish this weapon to the highest authority when we reach the crèche.

94.speaker: Lae'zel
94.text: Consider it the price for your purification.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: The rider mentioned a weapon. What do you know of it?

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: It is a polyhedric device marked with gith runes, if the kith'rak is to be believed.

104.speaker: Lae'zel
104.text: I know nothing more. No gith text describes such a weapon. I am not certain it even exists.

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: You do not have the authority. Defer to your leader.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: You are full up. Dismiss your weakest warrior.

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: You are full up. Dismiss your weakest warrior.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Go to my camp. We can speak there.

122.speaker: Lae'zel
122.text: Very well. But heed my words.

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: A crèche is near - we must seek signs of it. Only there can we be purified.

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: Search these corpses for a map, and beware the skies. We are watched.

103.speaker: Lae'zel
103.text: I will await word at your camp.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: I will await word at your camp. And beware the skies. We are watched.

89.speaker: Lae'zel
89.text: A sensible choice. Our alliance has proven beneficial to us both.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: You have made an ally from Crèche K'liir - few know such fortune. Call me Lae'zel.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Fool. No point in showing the beast kindness - it'll still bite you in the end.

111.speaker: Shadowheart
111.text: Fool. No point in showing the beast kindness - it'll still bite you in the end.

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: You've a sharp tongue, elf. Would that your mind proved its equal.

99.speaker: Shadowheart
99.text: Half-elf. I suppose the finer details are lost on a creature like you.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: A githyanki crèche must be near; its ghustil has the means to cleanse us.

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: A githyanki crèche must be near; its ghustil has the means to cleanse us.

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: Enough. A githyanki crèche must be near; its ghustil has the means to cleanse us.

60.speaker: Lae'zel
60.text: Search these corpses for a map. And beware the skies. We are watched.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: Forward, through the pass. And beware the skies. We are watched.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: Enough. A crèche is near - we must seek signs of it. Search these corpses for a map.

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: A crèche is near - we must seek signs of it. Search these corpses for a map.

3.speaker: Lae'zel
3.text: Enough. A crèche is near - we must seek signs of it. Forward, through the pass.

8.speaker: Lae'zel
8.text: And beware the skies. We are watched.

95.speaker: Lae'zel
95.text: A crèche is near - we must seek signs of it. Forward, through the pass.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I am pursuing other means to a cure. I don't need whatever you're offering.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: Githyanki teaching is as infallible as Queen Vlaakith herself. To remove a tadpole, there are but two paths: purification at a crèche - or beheading.

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: Any other 'cure' might be offered is a lie. Cast it from your mind.

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: An abomination grows within you, yet you would refuse purification?

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: Bah. You invite your own misery.

106.speaker: Lae'zel
106.text: Yet even a feared sarth could not break you in battle. Yes - you may be of considerable use.

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: You survived longer than I expected. I cannot say the same for the tieflings you abandoned me with.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to player at start of node.

105.speaker: Lae'zel
105.text: I remember. You were on the gh'ath. The nautiloid. You carry a tadpole.
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to player at start of node.NodeContext: gah-ATH

33.speaker: Narrator
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to player at start of node.NodeContext: Turns to player at start of node.

51.speaker: Lae'zel
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to player at start of node.NodeContext: Turns to player at start of node.

92.speaker: Lae'zel
92.text: ...you survived longer than I expected without me to aid you.

102.speaker: Lae'zel
102.text: It is time you finally lend me your skills. We may locate this crèche together, and be purified.

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: Shka'keth! I have followed protocol. He does not speak for Vlaakith!
45.context: NodeContext: Infuriated, suspicious. SHKA-keth. Like it is spelled, a but guttural. He is calling the knight that flew off an ASSHOLE!

66.speaker: Lae'zel
66.text: I will be pure. I will join my queen!

54.speaker: Lae'zel
54.text: Shka'keth! I have followed protocol. He does not speak for Vlaakith!
54.context: NodeContext: Infuriated, suspicious. SHKA-keth. Like it is spelled, a but guttural. He is calling the knight that flew off an ASSHOLE!

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I would like you to continue your journey with me.

121.speaker: Lae'zel
121.text: And you. Of course. Even death cannot sever our alliance, it would seem.
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to player at start of node.NodeContext: Turns to player at start of node.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: What just happened? Your own is out for blood.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: The artefact suddenly seems to weigh heavily on you. Quickly turn to other matters.

110.speaker: Lae'zel
110.text: Shka'keth! I should have your head for interfering with protocol.
